head.title: Mitchell Stanley Weds Miss Sterritt in London

hedline.hl1: Mitchell Stanley Weds Miss Sterritt in London

block.p: LEAD: Kathleen Joan Sterritt, an assistant features editor of The Washington Post Magazine, and Mitchell Fanning Stanley, the special assistant to the Secretary of Commerce, were married in London yesterday at the Queen's Chapel of the Savoy, of the Church of England. The Rev. John H. Williams performed the ceremony.

LEAD: Kathleen Joan Sterritt, an assistant features editor of The Washington Post Magazine, and Mitchell Fanning Stanley, the special assistant to the Secretary of Commerce, were married in London yesterday at the Queen's Chapel of the Savoy, of the Church of England. The Rev. John H. Williams performed the ceremony.

Kathleen Joan Sterritt, an assistant features editor of The Washington Post Magazine, and Mitchell Fanning Stanley, the special assistant to the Secretary of Commerce, were married in London yesterday at the Queen's Chapel of the Savoy, of the Church of England. The Rev. John H. Williams performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Stanley, the daughter of Mrs. Jack F. Wayman of Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla., and Arthur P. Sterritt of Edgewater, Fla., graduated from the Bolles School and Vanderbilt University. Her father, who is retired, was a vice president of the Independent Life and Accident Insurance Company in Jacksonville, Fla., and her stepfather, the late Mr. Wayman, was a lawyer.

Mr. Stanley, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell K. Stanley of Chevy Chase, Md., and Marion, Mass., graduated from the Landon School and the School of Foreign Service of Georgetown University. His father, who is retired, was an intelligence officer for the State Department. His mother, Mary F. Stanley, retired as chief of the Presidential appointments staff under the Director General of the Foreign Service.
